scene.name: intro
scene.line: Oh, it's triangles within triangles down here! Shifting, intersecting, overlaying ... isn't it romantic? Let's see:
`(To SHANNON.)` You're here to steal back the love of a boy you once knew, when you were too young to recognize the movements of the heart ...
`(To CONWAY.)` And you're escorting her, pretending to have her interests at heart while really ...

`(To JUNEBUG.)` ... really, you're in love with the young woman as well, and so you've agreed to help him conspire to win her affections, but it's just a ploy to set him up for embarrassment, and diminish him out of the picture!

scene.name: junebug-into-it
scene.line: Well, maybe I still have the knack ...

scene.name: what-are-you-talking-about
scene.line: No, you're right. It's insipid. Derivative.

scene.name: used-to-be-good-at-this
scene.line: I used to be really good at this! I had eleven novels published, from "The Billionaire's Bidding" to "Fields of Longing." Real hot, bodice-ripping stuff, you know? I miss those days in my Lexington studio apartment â€” just me and my thesaurus, steaming up the windows ...
scene.option: `(To EZRA.)` I'm not sure you should be listening to this, kid.

scene.name: ezra-shouldnt-be-listening
scene.line: But of course it couldn't last ...

scene.name: why-stop-writing
scene.line: You know, suddenly it was all computers everywhere you went. I thought I might be able to do something with that. Inject a little libido into those ugly beige boxes. Ha! So I went back to the university and I studied human-computer interaction, and then I picked up Donald's research assistantship here, as a tester. Debugging.

In my off-hours, I played around with the doomed love story at the core of our little simulation. That seemed to amuse Donald, so I kept at it ... I'm afraid I tinkered too much, made it too complex. Now our work is never done. We don't even have to add any new functionality: the bugs just grow on their own. Too complex.
I miss those days in my Lexington studio apartment ...
